item.description:
Wait - Didn't we just do this ride? You bet, in fact it was so great that we are doing it again!

Yes, it's that time of year again!

The ride to Mt Greylock in North Adams is a club favorite, some of the best tarcake to be had resides on the sides of the highest point in Massachusetts following a complete overhaul of the road in 2008.

We will depart from the Concord Rotary a little after Sunrise and get back at Sunset and while we are at it.. let's toss in a stop at Country Kitchen for some Mac & Cheese, ride up to Hog Back, eat and head for Tammy's Candy Kettle for ice cream, then we hit Greylock!

Heading out is 4 hours in the saddle and a flat 3 back home - in a 15 hour day, that gives us 7 hours to take lots of photos, eat, gas, de-monkey-butt and schmooze with the locals!

If we don't fit it all in, that's ok - I don't want to feel rushed, just feel the rush - this will be a fun ride with all the trimmings.

Here's the route out MAP How we get back depends on how much time we have left.

This is an official Touring club ride open to all paid touring members. Not one? Fill out the member form in the files section and bring it with $20 annual dues to the ride and you're in!
item.how_to_find_us: No, this is not a private home or office, it's a gas station!
item.name: One word: Greylock!
